page.title: 02Housing in Halesowen
page.content: Since the 1960's housing estates have sprung up throughout Halesowen. The Squirrels Estate built around the mid-70's was anticipated as early as the 1960's due to increasing population figures. Prior to this in the late sixties, two new housing estates appeared, Halesmere and Huntlands, all of these were greatly opposed as they wrecked valuable farm land. During the fifties when housing was a problem, council houses were erected in the Huntingtree area. They barely reached acceptable living standards. One house in Halesown has survived almost 900 years. Located near the town centre, White Friars is believed to be an old manor house. Of timber frame construction, the original walls were made of wattle and daub.
